intro: Physaria cobrensis, commonly known as the cobrensis bluemink, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes mustard and cabbage plants. The plant is characterized by its compact growth habit, with hairy stems and small, blue to purple flowers that bloom in late spring. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and covered in fine pubescence, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Physaria cobrensis is adapted to arid environments and is often found in rocky soils and desert scrub habitats.
